title: Real-Time Notifications Feed System Design (WebSocket/SSE)
description:
Design a real-time notifications feed for a front-end system design interview. Cover feed architecture, WebSocket/SSE/polling subscriptions, buffering and batching to avoid re-render storms, virtualized list rendering for large feeds, and unread state consistency. Explain how the UI stays fast under bursty traffic, reconnects, and slow devices.

Functional requirements:
- Receive new notifications in real time (push or polling).
- Render a scrollable feed with new items appearing at the top.
- Support read/unread state, clear-all, and basic filtering (e.g., only mentions).
- Show a badge/count for unseen notifications.
- Handle network errors and reconnects gracefully.

Non-functional:
- Avoid re-render storms when bursts of events arrive.
- Keep memory and DOM size bounded (virtualization, trimming).
- Maintain smooth scrolling (60 FPS target).
- Be resilient to slow devices and unstable networks.
- INP <= 200ms for panel interactions.

Data / state considerations:
- Notification objects include id, type, content, timestamp, read/unread, and optional actions.
- A small client-side buffer queues incoming events before render.
- A view model layer maintains a bounded list (latest N) plus metadata like unreadCount and lastSeenCursor.
